tools.name: n8n_list_workflows
tools.description: Retrieve all workflows with their status, tags, and metadata. Returns workflow ID, name, active status, creation date, and tags. Use this to browse available automations or find a specific workflow by name.

tools.name: n8n_get_workflow
tools.description: Get complete workflow definition including all nodes, connections, and settings. Returns full workflow JSON with node configurations and data flow. Use this to inspect workflow logic before modifying or executing.

tools.name: n8n_create_workflow
tools.description: Create a new automation workflow with nodes and connections. Provide workflow name, node array, and connection object. Optionally activate immediately. Returns new workflow with assigned ID.

tools.name: n8n_update_workflow
tools.description: Modify existing workflow structure or settings. Update workflow name, add/remove nodes, or change connections. Workflow must be deactivated first for structure changes. Returns updated workflow.

tools.name: n8n_delete_workflow
tools.description: Permanently delete a workflow and all associated execution history. This action cannot be undone. Workflow must be deactivated first. Use with caution.

tools.name: n8n_activate_workflow
tools.description: Start a workflow to listen for triggers (webhooks, schedules, etc). Activating enables automatic execution when trigger conditions are met. Workflow must have valid trigger nodes.

tools.name: n8n_deactivate_workflow
tools.description: Stop a workflow from listening to triggers. Deactivating prevents automatic execution but preserves workflow configuration. Use before making structure changes.

tools.name: n8n_execute_workflow
tools.description: Manually trigger workflow execution with optional input data. Useful for testing or API-driven workflows without webhooks. Returns execution ID to track progress. Does not require workflow to be active.

tools.name: n8n_get_workflow_tags
tools.description: Retrieve tags assigned to a workflow for categorization. Returns array of tag names. Use this to understand workflow organization before bulk operations.

tools.name: n8n_update_workflow_tags
tools.description: Assign tags to a workflow for organization and filtering. Replaces existing tags completely. Use tags like "production", "testing", or team names. Create missing tags automatically.

tools.name: n8n_list_executions
tools.description: Retrieve execution history with status, timestamps, and workflow info. Filter by workflow ID or get all executions. Returns execution ID, status (success/error/running), start time, and workflow name. Use this to monitor automation performance or debug failures.

tools.name: n8n_get_execution
tools.description: Get detailed execution data including node outputs, error messages, and timing. Returns full execution log with data passed between nodes. Essential for debugging failed workflows or understanding data flow.

tools.name: n8n_delete_execution
tools.description: Remove execution record from history to save storage or clean up test runs. Permanently deletes execution data. Use after debugging or to maintain clean execution logs.

tools.name: n8n_retry_execution
tools.description: Rerun a failed execution with the same input data. Useful for transient errors like network timeouts. Creates new execution while preserving original execution log. Only works with failed executions.

tools.name: n8n_create_credential
tools.description: Store new API credentials for services like GitHub, Slack, or databases. Provide credential type, descriptive name, and authentication data. Use get_credential_schema first to see required fields for each type.

tools.name: n8n_update_credential
tools.description: Update credential name or authentication data. Use this when rotating API keys or changing OAuth tokens. Workflows using this credential will use updated auth immediately.

tools.name: n8n_delete_credential
tools.description: Remove stored credential. Cannot delete credentials currently used in active workflows. Deactivate dependent workflows first. Use with caution as this may break workflows.

tools.name: n8n_get_credential_schema
tools.description: Get required fields and format for a credential type before creating it. Returns field names, types, and whether fields are required. Use this to understand what authentication data is needed.

tools.name: n8n_list_tags
tools.description: Retrieve all available tags for workflow organization. Returns tag ID and name. Use this before assigning tags to workflows or to see your tagging structure.

tools.name: n8n_get_tag
tools.description: Get tag details including ID and name. Rarely needed - use list_tags for most cases. Useful for validating tag existence before bulk operations.

tools.name: n8n_create_tag
tools.description: Create new tag for workflow categorization. Use meaningful names like "production", "staging", "team-marketing", or "urgent". Tags help filter and organize workflows.

tools.name: n8n_update_tag
tools.description: Rename an existing tag. All workflows using this tag will automatically reflect the new name. Use this to standardize tag naming across workflows.

tools.name: n8n_delete_tag
tools.description: Remove tag from system. Automatically removes this tag from all workflows using it. Tag removal does not affect workflows themselves, only the tag association.

tools.name: n8n_list_variables
tools.description: Retrieve all environment variables accessible in workflows via $vars. Returns key, value, and type. Use this to manage configuration across multiple workflows without hardcoding values.

tools.name: n8n_create_variable
tools.description: Store global configuration value accessible in all workflows. Use for API URLs, default values, or environment-specific settings. Variables can be strings, numbers, booleans, or JSON objects.

tools.name: n8n_update_variable
tools.description: Change variable value or key. All workflows using this variable will immediately use the new value. Use this to switch between dev/staging/prod configs without editing workflows.

tools.name: n8n_delete_variable
tools.description: Remove environment variable. Workflows referencing this variable will throw errors on next execution. Ensure no workflows depend on this variable before deleting.

tools.name: n8n_list_users
tools.description: Retrieve all n8n users with their roles and status. Only available to instance owner. Returns user ID, email, role (owner/admin/member), and disabled status. Use this for user management and auditing.

tools.name: n8n_get_user
tools.description: Get detailed user information by ID or email. Only available to instance owner. Returns user profile including role and account status. Use this to verify user details before role changes.

tools.name: n8n_delete_user
tools.description: Remove user from n8n instance. Only available to instance owner. Cannot delete the owner account. Deleted users lose access immediately. Workflows created by this user remain intact.

tools.name: n8n_update_user_role
tools.description: Change user permission level. Only available to instance owner. Admin can manage workflows and credentials. Member has view-only or limited edit access. Cannot change owner role.
